name: Wave Equation
explanation: Wave speed equals frequency times wavelength (v = fλ). Frequency (f) is cycles per second (Hz), wavelength (λ) is distance between peaks, period (T) is time for one cycle. This fundamental relationship applies to all waves: sound, light, water waves, and electromagnetic waves. Essential for understanding wave behavior, interference, and resonance.

examples.problem: Sound wave has frequency 440 Hz and wavelength 0.78 m. What is speed?
Light has wavelength 500 nm. What is frequency? (c = 3×10⁸ m/s)

proof: v = fλ. Proof: In one period T, wave travels distance λ (one wavelength). Speed = distance/time = λ/T. Since f = 1/T, we get v = λf = fλ.
